pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreTitle: Hall of Fame Series. An evening with Little Richard. Pt. 1.
pbcoreDescriptionDocument.pbcoreDescription: Rock Hall V.P. of Education Robert Santelli and Curator Jim Henke discuss the origins of rock and roll with Little Richard, after a performance by him and hnis band. 1997 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH during “An Evening with Little Richard,” an installment of the Hall of Fame Series. The band’s musical director Wayne Chaney introduces the performance, after a brief note by Santelli.
Performed songs. [Instrumental intro] -- [Piano instrumental] -- Good golly Miss Molly -- Jambalaya (On the bayou) -- Chains of love -- Lucille -- Blueberry Hill -- Old time rock and roll.

fields.abstract: Rock Hall V.P. of Education Warren Zanes and Curator Jim Henke discuss the origins of rock and roll with Little Richard after he and his band perform on September 15, 1997 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH during “An Evening with Little Richard,” an installment of the Hall of Fame Series. The band’s musical director Wayne Chaney introduces the performance, which includes “Good Golly Miss Molly,” “Jambalaya (On the Bayou),” “Chains of Love,” “Lucille,” “Blueberry Hill,” “Old Time Rock and Roll,” and a few instrumental jams.

Rock Hall V.P. of Education Robert Santelli and Curator Jim Henke discuss the origins of rock and roll with Little Richard after he and his band perform on September 15, 1997 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH during “An Evening with Little Richard,” an installment of the Hall of Fame Series. The band’s musical director Wayne Chaney introduces the performance, which includes “Good Golly Miss Molly,” “Jambalaya (On the Bayou),” “Chains of Love,” “Lucille,” “Blueberry Hill,” “Old Time Rock and Roll,” and a few instrumental jams.

Rock Hall V.P. of Education Robert Santelli and Curator Jim Henke discuss the origins of rock and roll with Little Richard after he and his band perform on September 15, 1997 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH during “An Evening with Little Richard,” an installment of the Hall of Fame Series. The band’s musical director Wayne Chaney introduces the performance, which includes “Good Golly Miss Molly,” “Jambalaya (On the Bayou),” “Chains of Love,” “Lucille,” “Blueberry Hill,” “Old Time Rock and Roll,” and a few instrumental jams.
